result.execSummary:
The defendant Daquaris M. Conners was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $997.36 to Bonita T.; $347.00  to Walgreens; $412.00 to Family Dollar; $300.00 to Walgreens; and $220.00 to CVS.  First priority.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge, all court costs, fees and surcharges.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil jdugment and/or tax intercept or other means. To be paid by end of supervison.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence/count.  Credit for 342 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Follow all rules of supevision. 
Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
All applicable fees of supervision by end of supervision.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

No alcohol or drugs.  No posession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with all victims named in the complaint, employees and the stores.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence. **4/1/2015  Credit for 342 days.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence/count.  Credit for zero days.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence/count.  *4/1/2015  Credit of 342  days.
****Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program after four (4) years of confinement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daquaris M. Conners

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (28 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing MARCH 12, 2015 received and filed.
Per Order signed on April 1, 2015:  shall be amended to refelct 342 days of sentence credit on counts two and four as well as count one.
Order Amending Judgement of Conviction signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and the Department of Corrections.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  jbs
Letter from DOC seeking review of sentence credit.

Defendant Daquaris M. Conners in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 342 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

As to Count 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after 4 YEARS of confinement.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: all victims named in the complaint (employees and the stores)
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $997.36 payable to Bonita T, $347.00 payable to Walgreens, $412.00 payable to Family Dollar, $300.00 payable to Walgreens and $220.00 payable to CVS - FIRST PRIORITY; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Letter in Support of the Defendant received and filed.
PSI received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.

Defendant Daquaris M. Conners in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Defendant Daquaris M. Conners in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
As to Counts 1-4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court Orders PSI report without recommendation.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark A Pecora in court.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however Branch 22 is in jury trial.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court orders that all conditions of bail that were previously ordered be reinstated.

Defendant Daquaris M. Conners in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Defendant Daquaris M. Conners in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Dept of Health Services report dated 10/28/2014 received and filed.  Parties notified.

Defendant Daquaris M. Conners in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Defendant Daquaris M. Conners in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  The Court found that an inpatient examination is necessary and committed the defendant to the Department of Health Services for a competency examination and report pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2)(3) of Wisconsin Statutes.  Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services signed and filed.
Case adjourned for return on doctors report in Branch 22.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Case in court for return on doctors report.  Defense attorney contacted the court by phone, he had the date as tomorrow.  DA and Court do not object to adjourning case until tomorrow.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Forensic report received and filed. Parties notified.

Defendant Daquaris M. Conners in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Defendant Daquaris M. Conners in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant may not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant be examined by the forensic unit.  Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 22.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark A Pecora in court, defendant Daquaris M. Conners not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pre-trial conference.  Defense requests further proceedings date to address competency.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Further proceedings scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark A Pecora in court, defendant Daquaris M. Conners not in court, in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Irene Parthum.
For reasons stated off the record to the Court, and with the agreement of all parties, Pretrial Conference scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 09-04-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark A Pecora in court, defendant Daquaris M. Conners not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 08-04-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark A Pecora in court, defendant Daquaris M. Conners not in court, in custody.  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-25-2014 at 08:30 am.

Consent And Order For Substution Of Counsel, SIGNED AND FILED.
IT IS ORDERED that Attorney Marc A Pecora be substituted as attorney of record for the defendant Daquaris M Conners in this action in place of Attorney Darryl E Smith.
COPY FORWARDED TO PEGGY STRAND, HARTLEY & PECORA, IN SASE PROVIDED.
FILE UNAVAILABLE AT THE TIME OF THIS ENTRY.
Draft Consent And Order For Substitution Of Attorney, (original and copy), with SASE for return of signed copy, RECEIVED.

Defendant Daquaris M. Conners in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Daquaris M. Conners in custody.  Thomas Potter for  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Ronald Linzmeyer-MPD Detective.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daquaris M. Conners in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Step Nolten for Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court was informed at 11:50am that defense would like a hearing.  Court adjourned the case until 1:30pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Daquaris M. Conners
Current: 10242 W. Fountain, Milwaukee, WI 53224   (Effective: 04-11-2014)
Prior: 1820 W Wells St, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walgreens 5201 N. 91st St., CVS 6330 N. 76th St., Family Dollar 9014 W. Appleton, Bonita T., Jessica L., Reginaldo H., Quinesha B. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daquaris M. Conners in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Daquaris M. Conners in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
